name: What Begins With J? Quiz | Alphabetics | 10 Questions

questions.text: What 'J' was the gentleman's gentleman created by P. G. Wodehouse?
questions.explanation:
Jeeves.

	Jeeves is the unflappable servant whose employer is the amiable idiot Bertie Wooster.

questions.text: What 'J' is the capital of Indonesia?
questions.explanation:
Jakarta.

	Its pre-independence name was Batavia.

questions.text: Which Old Testament 'J' was thrown into a pit?
questions.explanation:
Jeremiah.

	Jeremiah was thrown into a pit for criticizing King Zedekiah (Jeremiah chapter 38).

questions.text: Which 'J' became President of France in 1995?
questions.explanation:
Jacques Chirac.

	Jospin is the current {PM;} Jacques Chirac, former PM, is currently President. Josselin is one of Jospin's ministers. And Jean Jaures is a French political leader of the early 20th century.

questions.text: What 'J' is the national flower of Pakistan?
questions.explanation:
Jasmine.

	Jasmine is the national flower of Pakistan. Indonesia and the Philippines also have Jasmine as a national symbol.

questions.text: Which 'J' was the monarch of the Netherlands before Queen Beatrix?
questions.explanation:
Juliana.

	Juliana is the previous monarch, Johan Friso is Queen Beatrix's second son. Jorge is Beatrix's ex-brother-in-law. Julius is one of the middle names of Bernhard, Queen Juliana's husband.

questions.text: Which 'J' is a disgraced ex-MP, in prison in Britain for perjury from 2001 to 2003?
questions.explanation:
Jeffrey Archer.

	Jeffrey Archer, former Conservative MP, peer and novelist, was tried and convicted in May 2001 (released July 2003). Jonathan Aitken is another former Conservative MP who was convicted of perjury in 1999. John Stonehouse was a Labour MP involved in fraud charges in the 1970s, and Jim Slater (not an MP) was involved in the Slater Walker financial scandal also in the 1970s.

questions.text: Which 'J' won Britain's only gold medal in the 2001 World Athletics championships in Edmonton?
questions.explanation:
Jonathan Edwards.

	Jonathan Edwards won gold in the triple jump. Jonathan Moore is an up and coming triple jumper. John Regis is an established 200m runner, and Jon Brown is a leading distance runner.

questions.text: Which 'J' is NOT a make of car?
questions.explanation:
Jura.

	Justy is a Subaru, Jimny is a Suzuki, Jetta is a Volkswagen. Jura is a placename in France and Scotland.

questions.text: In Roman myth, which 'J' is the wife of Jupiter?
questions.explanation:
Juno.

	Juno's Greek equivalent is Hera.
